content:
Staining of Drosophila whole mount embryos for -
. .V.
modified from that developed by Hiromi)
Collect embryos of the appropriate age from plates
2.) Place embryos in mesh baskets in H20 in staining plates
3.) Transfer basket to bleach to dechorionate 1-3 minutes.
Check with stereomicroscope to be sure chorion removed.
4.) Transfer basket to H20 to wash off bleach.
5.) Fix embryos in heptane with fixative (25% glutaraldehyde
in 50mM cacodylate buffer at pH 7.3). Fix in basket in
staining dish for 15 minutes. Embryos should turn
yellow.
6.) Prepare 35mm plastic petri dish with double stick Scotch
tape on the bottom. Add sufficient PBS to cover half the
taped surface. Transfer embryos from basket onto tape.
Finish filling petri dish with PBS.
7.) Remove vitelline surrounding embryos with
tungsten needle.
8.) Transfer devitellinized embryos by pipette into eppendorf
tube.
9.) Rinse with pH 7.2
10.) Remove liquid. Incubate with staining solution
Xgal/Fe/NaP2 or overnight at room temperature or at
37 C. (Staining solution 30 ul Xgal/1.2 mlFe/ 
11.) Remove staining solution rinse quickly in 100% ETOH,
vorteg.
12.) Store embryos in PBS
13.) Mount embryos in glycerin, using spacers made fron
broken cover slips if you wish to rotate the embryos
during viewing.
